description: Maximal number of 4-tree rows in n-tree orchard problem.
comments: Maximum number of rows with exactly 4 trees in each row if there are n trees in the orchard.
references: S. A. Burr, B. Grünbaum and N. J. A. Sloane, The Orchard Problem, Geometriae Dedicata, 2 (1974), 397-424.
M. Gardner, Time Travel and Other Mathematical Bewilderments. Freeman, NY, 1988, Chap. 22.
Xianzu Lin, A new result about orchard-planting problem, Preprint, 2005. [Shows a(20) >= 23.]
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: P. Berloquin, a(12) >= 7 (from an article in Jeux & Strategies from 1983 - see Fig. 10)
S. A. Burr, B. Grünbaum and N. J. A. Sloane, The Orchard Problem, Geometriae Dedicata, 2 (1974), 397-424.
Du, Zhao Hui, Code to verify a(13) to a(16) for orchard planting problem
Xianzu Lin, Illustration showing that a(20) >= 23 [The points S and T are at infinity]
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Orchard-Planting Problem.
Link to one of the optimal results from 13~17 trees [From _Du, Zhao Hui_, Nov 11 2008]
Author?, A chinese webpage for the problem [From _Du, Zhao Hui_, Dec 17 2009]
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
